sentence: While most sectors are on the last leg of the Q2 earnings season, the main show is left for the Retail/Wholesale sector.
Hence, investors are still all out and watchful, gearing up to replenish their portfolios.
The retail environment is still plagued by challenges including overseas turmoil, yet-to-recover Chinese economy, fluctuating commodity prices and sluggish traffic.
Apart from this, colder-than-normal weather in the significant spring-selling season largely impacted second-quarter comparable store sales through May.
However, it is said that change is the only thing constant and we believe that the sector is positioned to gain from the improving U.S. economy.
Retail Sector Still Holds the Baton - Why?
As always, the Retail/Wholesale sector has plenty of reasons to cheer, which help it hold the baton strong.

Notably, the real gross domestic product (GDP) advance estimate for the second quarter of 2016 improved at an annual rate of 1.2%, against a 0.8% rise witnessed in the preceding quarter, per the Bureau of Economic Analysis.
Additionally, we note that the U.S. labor market looks quite steady, with the unemployment rate for July remaining stable at 4.9% and the jobs data for July coming in better than expected.
These factors, along with improved U.S. consumer spending usher in confidence about this earnings season for the Retail/Wholesale sector.
So, let's take a quick look at how the earnings trend has actually unveiled so far, per our Earnings Trend report published on Aug 5, 2016.
Per the report, about 50% of the total number of S&P 500 companies in this sector had reported their results, wherein 45.5% delivered an earnings beat and 18.2% cruised ahead of revenue estimates.
Moreover, the top and bottom lines jumped 8.1% and 8.7% year over year, respectively.
Well, this is not it.
Total earnings for the Retail/Wholesale sector are expected to climb by 2.1%, with revenues projected to rise 4.8% in Q2.
That said, we bring to you five retail stocks that show promise, based on their favorable Zacks Rank - Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) - and a positive Earnings ESP .
Our research shows that for stocks with this combination, the chance of a positive earnings surprise is as high as 70%.
It makes sense to add these potential winners to your portfolio ahead of their earnings releases.
A rational investment can fetch higher returns on the heels of an earnings beat.
Investors can count on Macy's Inc. ( M ), one of the leading department store retailers in the U.S., with a Zacks Rank #3 and an Earnings ESP of +25.00%.
The current Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2016 stands at 40 cents.
This Cincinnati, OH-based company registered an average positive earnings surprise of 3.9% over the trailing four quarters, and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 8.5%.
The company is set to report results on Aug 11.
We also suggest investing in home improvement retailer, The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ).
With a Zacks Rank #3, the stock carries a long-term earnings growth rate of 13.7% and an Earnings ESP of +1.54%.
The current Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2016 is pegged at $1.95, representing a year over year growth of 14.3%.
This Atlanta, GA-based company has a spectacular earnings history, having outperformed the Zacks Consensus Estimate for four years now, with an average trailing four-quarter beat of 4.2%.
The company is scheduled to report results on Aug 16.
Another home improvement retailer that holds promise is Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ).
Flaunting a Zacks Rank #2, the company carries an Earnings ESP of +2.13%.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2016 pegged at $1.41, reflecting a year over year growth of 17.6%.
This Mooresville, NC-based company registered an average positive earnings surprise of 0.6% over the trailing four quarters, and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 15.6%.
The company is slated to report results on Aug 17.
DICK's Sporting Goods Inc. ( DKS ), leading full-line sporting goods retailer in the U.S., is another solid bet.
This Zacks Rank #3 stock currently carries an Earnings ESP of +2.94%.
With its long-term growth rate at 12%, the Coraopolis, PA-based company registered an average positive earnings surprise of 0.2% over the trailing four quarters.
DICK's Sporting is expected to release second-quarter fiscal 2017 results on Aug 16, with the current Zacks Consensus Estimate pegged at 68 cents.
Last but not the least is L Brands Inc. ( LB ), with a Zacks Rank #3 and an Earnings ESP of +1.70%.
The current Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2016 is pegged at 59 cents.

This Columbus, OH-based specialty retailer of women's intimate and other apparel, beauty and personal care products, home fragrance products and accessories registered an average positive earnings surprise of nearly 4% over the trailing four quarters, and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 11.3%.
The company is scheduled to report results on Aug 17.
We think that the aforementioned stocks are likely to fulfill investors' expectations, given their strong fundamentals and growth prospects.
Add to this a splendid earnings history and expectations of earnings beat with their upcoming results, and these stocks totally deserve a look as they may bump up your returns.
